meanings.definition: A tool used to make objects appear larger.
meanings.sent1: I used a magnifier to see the tiny bug on the leaf.
meanings.sent2: The scientist used a magnifier to study the details of the fossil.
meanings.sent3: The detective's magnifier revealed the hidden clue on the map.
meanings.sent4: Her smile acted as a magnifier, brightening up the whole room.
meanings.sent5: The magnifier brought the intricate design into clear focus.

meanings.definition: A lens or combination of lenses that magnifies an image.
meanings.sent1: The magnifier helped me read the small text on the paper.
meanings.sent2: Photographers often use a magnifier to capture close-up shots.
meanings.sent3: The pirate thought the magnifier was a magical crystal.
meanings.sent4: His words were like a magnifier, amplifying the impact of the speech.
meanings.sent5: With the magnifier, the stars in the sky looked closer and brighter.

meanings.definition: A person or thing that magnifies or enlarges.
meanings.sent1: She was a magnifier of joy, spreading happiness wherever she went.
meanings.sent2: The new manager acted as a magnifier for the team's productivity.
meanings.sent3: The magnifier of rumors turned a small story into a big scandal.
meanings.sent4: His passion was a magnifier, making even the simplest tasks exciting.
meanings.sent5: The teacher's encouragement was a magnifier for the students' confidence.
